JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Stanislav Shevchuk
TEXT: The applicant , Mr Sergiy Volodymyrovych Masyuchenko , is a NORP national who was born in DATE in LOC and currently resides in GPE , GPE .

The applicant is a retired military officer . In DATE he instituted proceedings in ORG against the Dnipropetrovsk Regional Military Commissariat seeking to have his pension recalculated in accordance with the changes allegedly introduced by the relevant legal acts .
On DATE ORG allowed his claims and ordered ORG to recalculate his pension .

On DATE ORG reversed this resolution and rejected the applicant ’s claims in full . The court informed the applicant , in the operative part of its resolution , that it became enforceable immediately , but could be appealed to ORG within DATE .
The applicant did not appeal in cassation . The applicant allegedly unsuccessfully requested ORG to rule in his case , but provided no answer from it .
“ ( ... ) ORG of GPE is the highest judicial body in the system of courts of general jurisdiction .
The respective high courts are the highest judicial bodies of specialised courts . ( ... ) ”
“ ... CARDINAL . Plenary Supreme Court ... shall be composed of all the judges of ORG , Presidents of the higher specialised courts , their first deputies , presidents of ORG and ORG .
... CARDINAL ) provides the courts of general jurisdiction with recommendations on application of legislation , and if necessary declares recommendations of the higher specialised courts unlawful ;

CARDINAL ) NORP decides to institute proceedings before ORG with regard to constitutionality of the laws and other normative acts , and also with regard to official interpretation of the LAW and the legislative acts ;

... CARDINAL . Draft resolutions of ORG with recommendations on how to apply specific legislation in particular types of cases shall be sent to ORG and the Minister of Justice at least DATE before ORG meets ; ... ”

In accordance with LAW a court of cassation in administrative cases is ORG of GPE . Under LAW the parties to administrative proceedings may lodge cassation appeals with ORG against the judgments or rulings of the first - instance court and the court of appeal . The grounds for appeal in cassation are an erroneous application of the procedural or substantive law . In accordance with LAW , ORG can quash or amend judgments and rulings of the first - instance courts and the courts of appeal or adopt a new judgment upon appeal in cassation .

In accordance with paragraph CARDINAL of Chapter VII of LAW , appeals in cassation which concern decisions of the courts of general jurisdiction ( civil and commercial proceedings ) given in administrative cases and which have not been examined by ORG by DATE shall be transferred for examination to ORG .

The content , so far as relevant , of the Resolution of the Plenary Supreme Court of DATE is set out in the ORG ’s decision in the case of GPE v. GPE ( ( dec . ) , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE ) . ORG explained inter alia , with references to several legislative acts and normative acts of ORG , how the courts should approach examination of complaints lodged by former military servicemen with regard to recalculation of previously determined amounts of pensions previously assigned to them . ORG drew attention to the relevant legal and factual circumstances which should be taken into account in examining these cases by the courts .
